prompt:
Sophia is a biologist with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on May 13), my wife (birthday on September 19), my child_1 (birthday on September 06), my father (birthday on July 27), my mother (birthday on June 05), 
2) Attending a fashion week in Paris in week 24-25.

3) Attend a parenting workshop every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 13.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Sophia for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

checks_range.24: Attending a fashion week in Paris
checks_range.25: Attending a fashion week in Paris

response:
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year.

#*# Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
The second week of the year was a whirlwind of activity, with the lab buzzing with the excitement of new projects. I spent most of my time in meetings, discussing the feasibility of our proposed designs with colleagues and stakeholders. The discussions were engaging, and I was impressed by the diverse perspectives and ideas that emerged. Outside of work, we continued to enjoy the winter wonderland that our neighborhood had become. The kids were thrilled to have a snow day on Wednesday, and we made the most of it by building an epic snowman and having a friendly snowball fight. My wife and I also managed to squeeze in a romantic dinner at a cozy Italian restaurant, where we savored delicious pasta and wine. The highlight of the week, however, was the family game night on Friday. We gathered around the living room, surrounded by board games and snacks, and spent the evening laughing and competing with each other. It was a wonderful way to unwind and create memories together.

#*# Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): 
This week was a bit of a challenge, as the cold snap that had been gripping our region showed no signs of letting up. The temperatures plummeted to -10°C, making it difficult to venture out. However, we didn't let the cold stop us from enjoying the winter season. We bundled up and took a family walk through the park, marveling at the frozen lakes and snow-covered trees. The kids were fascinated by the ice formations and spent hours gazing at the frozen beauty. At work, I made significant progress on my design project, finalizing the initial sketches and beginning to explore the technical aspects of the proposal. My wife and I also started making plans for a family vacation, which we hope to take in the spring. We're considering a trip to the mountains, where we can hike and enjoy the great outdoors together. The weekend was a quiet one, with most of our time spent indoors, enjoying hot chocolate and reading books.

#*# Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th): 
The fourth week of the year was a busy one, with several deadlines looming in the lab. I spent most of my time working on my design project, meeting with colleagues to discuss the finer points of the proposal. The discussions were productive, and I was impressed by the team's dedication to delivering high-quality results. Outside of work, we continued to enjoy the winter season, taking a family trip to the local ski resort. The kids were thrilled to hit the slopes, and my wife and I were happy to watch them from the sidelines, sipping hot chocolate and enjoying the crisp mountain air. The weekend was a relaxing one, with most of our time spent at home, enjoying family movie nights and playing board games.

prompt:
Emma is a photographer with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on May 11), my wife (birthday on March 02), my child_1 (birthday on September 11), my father (birthday on August 19), my mother (birthday on August 30), 
2) Participating in a week-long sailing school in week 26-27.

3) Participate in a kite flying club every 3 weeks on weekends, starting from week 11.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)

Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***

response:
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year.

#*# Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
The second week of the year was a whirlwind of activity, with the lab buzzing with the excitement of new projects. I spent most of my time working on the energy efficiency design, pouring over data and running simulations to refine the concept. The team's enthusiasm was contagious, and we had lively discussions about the potential impact of our work. At home, we continued to enjoy the quiet of the post-holiday period, using the time to recharge and refocus. The kids were back in school, and we were grateful for the routine they brought to our lives. On the weekend, we took a family outing to the local museum, where we spent the afternoon exploring exhibits on science and technology. The kids were fascinated by the interactive displays, and we were impressed by the museum's efforts to make learning fun and engaging. As we walked home, the crisp winter air invigorated us, and we felt grateful for the simple pleasures in life.

#*# Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): 
This week was a significant milestone in the lab, as we finalized the initial design for the energy efficiency project. The team's hard work paid off, and we were thrilled with the results. We spent the week refining the design, making adjustments and tweaks to ensure it met our high standards. At home, we continued to enjoy the peaceful atmosphere, using the time to catch up on reading and relaxation. The kids were keeping busy with school and extracurricular activities, and we were proud of their dedication and enthusiasm. On the weekend, we hosted a dinner party for friends, and it was a wonderful opportunity to connect with like-minded individuals. The conversation was lively and engaging, and we felt grateful for the strong relationships in our lives. As the week drew to a close, we reflected on the progress we'd made and looked forward to the challenges ahead.
